cards.flavor: If a victim were ever found innocent, they would simply redefine guilt.
cards.name: Abyssal Accuser
cards.text:
Wither (This deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters.)
Abyssal Accuser must be blocked if able.

cards.flavor:
“Such wretches at least have companions, but I have nothing and no one.”
—Animus; or, The Mistake
cards.name: Abyssal Familiar
cards.text:
Wither (This deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters.)
When Abyssal Familiar dies, it deals 1 damage to you and to any target.

cards.name: Abyssal Pact
cards.text:
When Abyssal Pact enters, you draw two cards and each player loses 2 life.
Players can't gain life.
Damage can't be prevented.

cards.name: Act of Jealousy
cards.text:
Gain control of target creature until end of turn. Untap that creature. It gains haste until end of turn.
Agonize (You may cast this card from your graveyard by putting a -1/-1 counter on a creature you control in addition to paying its other costs. Then exile this card.)

cards.name: Alchemical Treatise
cards.text:
You have no maximum hand size.
{T}: Add {C}.
{3}, {T}: Create a Vial token. (It's an artifact with “{1}, Sacrifice this and another permanent: Draw a card. Activate only during your turn.”)

cards.flavor: Leticia and Haldean had much in store after the project: a wedding, their home...
cards.name: Alchemist's Abode
cards.text:
{T}: Add {C}.
{T}, Sacrifice Alchemist's Abode and another permanent: Draw a card. Activate only during your turn.

cards.flavor: Justice is blind to the laws that bind it and to the cruel intent that wields it.
cards.name: Angel of Justice
cards.text: Flying, vigilance

cards.flavor: Before considering how to become the man he wished to be, Barton learned first how to become anyone else.
cards.name: Anonymize
cards.text: Until end of turn, target creature loses all abilities and becomes a colorless Human with base power and toughness 1/1 and no name.

cards.name: Arcane Anesthesia
cards.text:
Flash
Enchant creature
When Arcane Anesthesia enters, tap enchanted creature.
Enchanted creature doesn't untap during its controller's untap step.

cards.flavor: Disrupting a spell can be as simple as disposing of its material components.
cards.name: Arcanotripsy
cards.text: Counter target instant or sorcery spell. If that spell is countered this way, exile it instead of putting it into its owner's graveyard.

cards.name: Artillery Mage
cards.text:
When Artillery Mage enters, it deals 5 damage to target creature you don't control.
{5}{R}, {T}, Discard a card: Artillery Mage deals 5 damage to target creature you don't control.

cards.flavor: Alchemical weaponry has industrialized war, rendering conquest little more than weighing resources against lives.
cards.name: Artillery Professor
cards.text: Whenever you cast a noncreature spell, creatures you control get +1/+0 until end of turn.

cards.flavor: Pillage is their only payment.
cards.name: Ash Freebooter
cards.text:
Ash Freebooter has first strike as long as it's attacking.
When Ash Freebooter enters, you may discard a card. If you do, draw a card.

cards.name: Ashen Mare
cards.text: {T}: Draw two cards. Starting with the next opponent in turn order, each opponent may discard a land card. The first to do so gains control of Ashen Mare. Activate only during your turn.

cards.name: Atomized Veil
cards.text:
Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn.
Create a Vial token. (It's an artifact with “{1}, Sacrifice this and another permanent: Draw a card. Activate only during your turn.”)

cards.flavor: Mortifying as it was, Wormwood and Barton agreed it was time to be honest with each other.
cards.name: Authenticity
cards.text:
Whenever you play a land, return a card at random from your graveyard to your hand.
Whenever you cast a green spell, reveal the top card of your library. If it's a land card, put it into your hand. Otherwise, mill it.

cards.name: Autumn Ward
cards.text:
Autumn Ward's power and toughness are each equal to the number of creature cards in your graveyard.
Unveil {2}{B}{G} ({2}{B}{G}: Transform this. Unveil only as a sorcery.)

cards.name: Fallen Warden
cards.text:
Trample
Fallen Warden's power and toughness are each equal to the number of creature cards in all graveyards.

cards.flavor:
“The very knowledge of evil corrupts. I have ensured silence will protect us all.”
—Prince Regent Edgar
cards.name: Avowed Silence
cards.text: Your opponents can't cast spells or activate abilities that aren't mana abilities this turn.

cards.flavor:
He is ready to kill to defend what little
honor he has not sold for power.
cards.name: Barker Duelist
cards.text:
Whenever Barker Duelist becomes blocked, defending player loses 1 life.
Unveil {3}{B}{R} ({3}{B}{R}: Transform this. Unveil only as a sorcery.)

cards.flavor: The power to kill is no longer a means, but the ultimate end.
cards.name: Abyss Howler
cards.text:
Abyss Howler must be blocked if able.
Whenever Abyss Howler becomes blocked, defending player loses 2 life and you gain 2 life.

cards.name: Barrow Banshee
cards.text:
Wither (This deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters.)
Whenever Barrow Banshee deals combat damage to an opponent, that player discards a card at random.

cards.name: Beatrice's Dodger
cards.text:
Whenever Beatrice's Dodger attacks, create a 1/1 black and red Human Rogue creature token that's tapped and attacking.
{3}{B}{R}: Return Beatrice's Dodger from your graveyard to the battlefield
tapped and transformed.

cards.name: Madame Beatrice
cards.text:
If Madame Beatrice would leave the battlefield, exile her instead.
Whenever one or more creatures you control deal combat damage to a player, that player reveals their hand. You may cast a card from their hand without paying its mana cost.

cards.flavor: All that mattered to the little doctor was reading her books. Every entry, every encyclopedia. Then, sharing every word, with any who would listen.
cards.name: Become Immersed
cards.text: Draw a card, then reveal any number of creature or land cards from your hand. You gain that much life.

cards.flavor: The months turned to years...
cards.name: Bereaved Aristocrat
cards.text:
Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt to and dealt by Bereaved Aristocrat.
Unveil {2}{W}{U} ({2}{W}{U}: Transform this. Unveil only as a sorcery.)

cards.flavor: ...yet she still felt the pain. She wept, until her tears were no more.
cards.name: Silent Reaver
cards.text:
Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt to Silent Reaver.
Prevent all combat damage Silent Reaver would deal to creatures.

cards.name: Bezoarbeast
cards.text: When Bezoarbeast dies, each opponent loses 2 life and you create a Vial token. (It's an artifact with “{1}, Sacrifice this and another permanent: Draw a card. Activate only during your turn.”)

cards.name: Bitter Leviathan
cards.text:
This spell can't be countered.
Whenever Bitter Leviathan becomes the target of a spell or ability, exile it. Return it to the battlefield under your control tapped and attacking at the beginning of the declare attackers step on your next turn. It can't be blocked that combat.

cards.name: Bitter Pact
cards.text:
When Bitter Pact enters, destroy target nonbasic permanent.
All permanents and players lose hexproof, indestructible, and protection and can't have or gain hexproof, indestructible, or protection.

cards.flavor: The great star on high then understood the sum of mortal suffering. They fell from heaven, and became the first fae.
cards.name: Bitter Starfall
cards.text: Return to your hand all permanent cards in your graveyard that were put there from the battlefield this turn.

cards.flavor: One can fall from grace not for evil but for losing their innocence to suffering.
cards.name: Bitter Stars
cards.text: Whenever you put one or more -1/-1 counters on a creature, create that many 1/1 black Faerie creature tokens with flying.

cards.flavor: Attachment to the dead won't bring them back, but sentiment mixed with magic can bring a corpse to imitate life.
cards.name: Black Cat
cards.text: When Black Cat dies, target opponent discards a card at random.

cards.name: Bleeding Aces
cards.text:
Discard your hand, then draw two cards.
Agonize (You may cast this card from your graveyard by putting a -1/-1 counter on a creature you control in addition to paying its other costs. Then exile this card.)

cards.name: Blinding Fiddler
cards.text:
When Blinding Fiddler enters, until your next turn, creatures can't attack you or a planeswalker you control unless their controller pays {2} for each of those creatures.
Unveil {3}{W}{U} ({3}{W}{U}: Transform this. Unveil only as a sorcery.)

cards.name: Ghastly Scraper
cards.text:
Creatures can't attack you or a planeswalker you control unless their controller pays {2} for each of those creatures.
Creatures can't block Ghastly Scraper unless their controller pays {2} for each of those creatures.

cards.name: Bloodpact Tormentor
cards.text:
When Bloodpact Tormentor enters, you may put a -1/-1 counter on target creature.
Bloodpact Tormentor can't be blocked by creatures with counters on them.

cards.flavor:
“Flight was once something we thought only a pact could grant. Nowadays, chemistry yields vapors lighter than air which power our own spells.”
—Professor Michael Haldean
cards.name: Blue-Sky Patrol
cards.text: Flying, prowess

cards.flavor:
“Abandoned, I should have died within days, yet we are both bound to life... isn't that right, my accursed creator?”
—Animus to Lettie Wormwood
cards.name: Bonds of Life
cards.text: Target creature gains indestructible until end of turn.

cards.flavor: It is not unusual for an inherited estate to leave many of its bedrooms and studies undisturbed.
cards.name: Bound Apparition
cards.text: Whenever Bound Apparition becomes the target of a spell or ability, put a -1/-1 counter on it.

changes: 2024-05-01 — Now sacrifices tokens instead of artifacts.
cards.name: Briarform Apothecary
cards.text:
When Briarform Apothecary enters, create a Vial token. (It's an artifact with “{1}, Sacrifice this and another permanent: Draw a card. Activate only during your turn.”)
Sacrifice a token: Briarform Apothecary gets +2/+2 until end of turn.

cards.flavor:
“True forms require the self as a material. Romanticized suicide.”
—Wormwood
cards.name: Bright Apprentice
cards.text:
Prowess
Unveil {2}{U}{R} ({2}{U}{R}: Transform this. Unveil only as a sorcery.)

cards.flavor:
“The self persists. If there is death, then the true form is a rebirth.”
—Doctor Barton
cards.name: Brilliant Diviner
cards.text:
Prowess, trample
Whenever Brilliant Diviner deals combat damage to a player, draw a card.

cards.name: Brimstone Grenadiers
cards.text:
{T}: Brimstone Grenadiers deals 1 damage to target player.
Whenever you cast an instant or sorcery spell, untap Brimstone Grenadiers.

cards.name: Broken Spirit
cards.text:
When Broken Spirit enters, exile target creature an opponent controls until Broken Spirit leaves the battlefield.
Persist (When this creature dies, if it had no -1/-1 counters on it, return it to the battlefield under its owner's control with a -1/-1 counter on it.)

cards.name: Burning Hatred
cards.text:
Burning Hatred deals 2 damage to any target.
Agonize (You may cast this card from your graveyard by putting a -1/-1 counter on a creature you control in addition to paying its other costs. Then exile this card.)

cards.flavor: They'd like to keep their peasants and eat them too.

cards.text:
Haste
Sacrifice another creature: Bygone Aristocrat gains indestructible until end of turn.

cards.name: Canal Kelpie
cards.text:
Hexproof
Persist (When this creature dies, if it had no -1/-1 counters on it, return it to the battlefield under its owner's control with a -1/-1 counter on it.)

cards.flavor: The individuality of a palace guard would only undermine their authority.
cards.name: Capital Watch
cards.text:
Vigilance
Unveil {2}{G}{W} ({2}{G}{W}: Transform this. Unveil only as a sorcery.)

cards.flavor: True forms always carry the risk of identity loss. In this case, it's desired.
cards.name: Watchful Authority
cards.text:
Vigilance, reach
Watchful Authority can block an additional creature each combat.

cards.name: Carapace Spider
cards.text:
Reach
Persist (When this creature dies, if it had no -1/-1 counters on it, return it to the battlefield under its owner's control with a -1/-1 counter on it.)

cards.flavor: Where demons hold power, there is cruelty; not as consequence, but as ultimate purpose.
cards.name: Carnage Fiend
cards.text: Wither (This deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters.)

cards.flavor: The bitterness of fae is born of anger and sympathy. Angels feel neither.
cards.name: Celestial Concordance
cards.text:
Choose one —
• Destroy all creatures.
• Create a 4/4 white Angel creature token with flying and vigilance.

cards.flavor: The royal family has a centuries-old angelic pact, with the condition that they unite humanity under angelic law by whatever means necessary.
cards.name: Celestial Favor
cards.text:
Flash
Creatures you control get +1/+1.

cards.name: Celestial Principality
cards.text:
Reach
As Celestial Principality enters, choose a number.
Noncreature spells with mana value equal to the chosen number can't be cast.

cards.name: Charred Phoenix
cards.text:
Flying, haste
You may cast Charred Phoenix from your graveyard by exiling four permanents you control and/or cards in your hand and/or graveyard as an additional cost.

cards.flavor: A life of hunger; first food, now blood.
cards.name: Claret Gorger
cards.text:
Haste
Claret Gorger can't block.
Unveil {2}{B}{R} ({2}{B}{R}: Transform this. Unveil only as a sorcery.)

cards.flavor: She now oversees an estate of one, its wealth secure for as long as she feeds.
cards.name: Wanton Cleaver
cards.text:
Lifelink, haste
Wanton Cleaver has first strike as long as it's attacking.

cards.flavor:
“Angels demand we join a struggle that started long before us, beyond our ken.”
—Lettie Wormwood
cards.name: Clash of Titans
cards.text: Target creature fights another target creature. (Each deals damage equal to its power to the other.)

cards.name: Clawed Flame
cards.text:
Whenever a creature enters under an opponent's control, you may have that player lose 1 life.
Unveil {2}{B}{R} ({2}{B}{R}: Transform this. Unveil only as a sorcery.)

cards.flavor: Where there is enough destruction, a demon will be born to cause more.
cards.name: Rending Fiend
cards.text: Whenever a creature enters, each opponent loses 1 life.

cards.name: Cleansweep
cards.text:
Return target nonland permanent to its owner's hand.
Agonize (You may cast this card from your graveyard by putting a -1/-1 counter on a creature you control in addition to paying its other costs. Then exile this card.)

cards.flavor: A single shot is all it takes to end even a lifetime of experience in battle.
cards.name: Clear Shot
cards.text: Target creature you control gets +1/+1 until end of turn. It deals damage equal to its power to target creature you don't control.

cards.name: Cold Embrace
cards.text:
Tap target creature. It doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step.
Agonize (You may cast this card from your graveyard by putting a -1/-1 counter on a creature you control in addition to paying its other costs. Then exile this card.)

cards.flavor: Lettie resolved to destroy every trace of her research—and if Haldean wanted to keep it for himself, she'd destroy him too.
cards.name: Creative Salvage
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, discard a nonland card.
Draw two cards.

cards.flavor:
“They choked on their misdeeds in life; I hold no sympathy for them. I wish only my creators will face such justice.”
—Animus; or, The Mistake
cards.name: Crimson Plague
cards.text: Distribute four -1/-1 counters among any number of target creatures.

cards.flavor: Once you've earned your wings, an angel's pact can provide all manner of silver bullets.
cards.name: Crossed Fire
cards.text: Distribute four -1/-1 counters among any number of target attacking or blocking creatures.

cards.flavor: A year of planeswalking changed Lettie; her trade became as much treachery as medicine.
cards.name: Cruel Vintage
cards.text:
Destroy target creature.
Create a Vial token. (It's an artifact with “{1}, Sacrifice this and another permanent: Draw a card. Activate only during your turn.”)

cards.flavor:
“I try to teach the urchins a bit about not giving in to greed; I should know just how easy a mark it makes you.”
—Madame Beatrice
cards.name: Curtailer Ploy
cards.text: Target player draws a card and loses 2 life, then discards three cards.

cards.flavor:
“Such radiance is a beautiful weapon—perhaps fearsome to some, but is that not essential to awe?”
—Professor Michael Haldean
cards.name: Cutting Brilliance
cards.text: Put three -1/-1 counters on target attacking or blocking creature.

cards.flavor: Leticia concluded that The Mistake, and she herself, never should have been.
cards.name: Deathly Dreams
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, sacrifice a creature.
Draw cards equal to the sacrificed creature's power.

cards.flavor:
“Nature's fine example is to discard that which no longer serves us, dear.”
—Haldean to Lettie Wormwood
cards.name: Deciduous Defense
cards.text: Target creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn. You may remove a -1/-1 counter from it.

cards.flavor: Admission to the apothecary's guild requires a life fully committed.
cards.name: Devoted Apothecary
cards.text:
Lifelink
Sacrifice Devoted Apothecary: Remove a counter from target permanent.

cards.flavor:
“Magic is the complex interplay of sympathetic materials with ritual. I need only disturb one part to triumph.”
—Professor Michael Haldean
cards.name: Disarray
cards.text: Counter target spell. Mill three cards.

cards.flavor: The voices smothered Lettie, layered one upon another until there was nothing but excruciating noise.
cards.name: Distress
cards.text: Target player reveals their hand. You choose a nonland card from it. That player discards that card.

cards.name: Divine Theurge
cards.text:
When Divine Theurge enters, choose one —
• Return target enchantment card from your graveyard to your hand.
• Return target creature card with power 2 or less from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.flavor: Fae find comfort in the longevity of trees, their companions in eternity.
cards.name: Doomed Woodsman
cards.text: When Doomed Woodsman dies, create a 1/1 green Faerie Druid creature token with hexproof.

cards.name: Dram Brewing
cards.text:
Search your library for a basic land card and put that card onto the battlefield tapped, then shuffle.
Create a Vial token. (It's an artifact with “{1}, Sacrifice this and another permanent: Draw a card. Activate only during your turn.”)

cards.flavor:
“Small freedoms we have granted the masses, but we will never abolish nobility.”
—Prince Regent Edgar
cards.name: Due of the Estate
cards.text: If an opponent controls more lands than you, search your library for up to three basic land cards, reveal them, put them into your hand, then shuffle.

cards.name: Edgar, Divine Regent
cards.text:
If a spell or ability an opponent controls causes you to discard Edgar, put it onto the battlefield instead of putting it into your graveyard.
Unveil {4}{G}{W} ({4}{G}{W}: Transform this. Unveil only as a sorcery.)

cards.name: Immortal Herald
cards.text:
Hexproof, indestructible
You don't lose the game for having 0 or less life.
For each 1 life you would lose while you have 0 or less life, instead put a -1/-1 counter on a creature you control with toughness 1 or greater.

cards.flavor: Heartbroken rage spilled onto the page.
cards.name: Emotive Impulse
cards.text: Up to two target creatures can't block this turn. Exile the top two cards of your library. Until the end of your next turn, you may play those cards.

cards.name: Endless Gossip
cards.text:
Draw a card for each creature you control.
Agonize (You may cast this card from your graveyard by putting a -1/-1 counter on a creature you control in addition to paying its other costs. Then exile this card.)

cards.flavor: As with the seasons, mortal life is a cruel cycle of renewal and rot.
cards.name: Equinox Sprite
cards.text: When Equinox Sprite enters, return target card from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Estate Scarecrow
cards.text:
Wither (This deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters.)
Persist (When this creature dies, if it had no -1/-1 counters on it, return it to the battlefield under its owner's control with a -1/-1 counter on it.)

cards.flavor: If not for the veil separating the Abyss from the mortal coil, its perpetual flames would consume all of creation.
cards.name: Eternal Flames
cards.text:
Put a -1/-1 counter on target creature.
Draw a card.

cards.flavor: At midnight's toll, they invite mortals to see what is better left unknown.
cards.name: Ethereal Guide
cards.text:
Flying
{3}{W}, {T}: Exile another target creature you control, then return that card to the battlefield under your control.

cards.name: Ethereal Pact
cards.text:
When Ethereal Pact enters, each player shuffles their hand and graveyard into their library, then draws seven cards.
Each player can't cast more than one spell each turn.

cards.flavor: On auspicious nights, a perpetual tide of souls breaches the veil, eager to claim more company for their ceaseless hunt.
cards.name: Ethereal Scouring
cards.text: Put target creature or planeswalker into its owner's library third from the top. Its controller creates a 1/1 white Spirit creature token with flying.

cards.flavor:
“Hunting the white stag.”
—An expression to describe someone who is convinced they can achieve the impossible.
cards.name: Fabled Stag
cards.text: Unveil {3}{G}{W} ({3}{G}{W}: Transform this. Unveil only as a sorcery.)

cards.flavor: Messengers of heaven, it is profanity to hunt them. Even if one were to succeed, what could the hunter possibly achieve next that could satisfy them?
cards.name: Venerated Beast
cards.text: Venerated Beast can't be blocked by more than one creature.

cards.flavor:
“A face changes to match the identity, and the person persists through it all.”
—Doctor Barton
cards.name: Faceless Virtue
cards.text: Whenever a creature blocks or becomes blocked by Faceless Virtue, that creature loses all abilities until end of combat.

cards.flavor:
“It may be beyond humanity's place to create life—but I—we both only wished our creation could ensure our legacy.”
—Haldean to Lettie Wormwood
cards.name: Fall to Ruin
cards.text:
This spell costs {1} less to cast for each permanent sacrificed this turn.
Destroy target noncreature permanent.

cards.name: Fallen Celestial
cards.text:
Flying, lifelink
Fallen Celestial can't block or be blocked by Angels, Demons, or Faeries.
At the beginning of each opponent's upkeep, that player loses 1 life and creates a 1/1 black Faerie creature token with flying.

cards.flavor: Innocence invites that which kills it.
cards.name: Fated Fall
cards.text:
Choose one —
• Exile target creature with flying.
• Exile up to three target cards from a single graveyard. Draw a card.

cards.flavor:
“A shame; my cousin could have rivaled most surgeons had she ever been allowed a scalpel rather than a blade.”
—Doctor Gareth Barton
cards.name: Fencing Grace
cards.text: Target creature gains double strike until end of turn. Mill a card.

cards.text:

At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player sacrifices a nonland permanent.

cards.flavor:
“A few decades, and this climate will be transmuted for the industry we desire.”
—Professor Michael Haldean

cards.name: Gallipot Apothecary

cards.flavor: There is little sense in killing fae; the death of unforgiven beings will simply give rise to yet more.

cards.flavor:
“Some fear the strays are fae-touched. I think they've done more to keep the urchins safe than anyone so concerned.”

{T}, Discard a card: Draw a card.

Flying

cards.flavor: Angels are above such petty things as desire or enthusiasm.

cards.flavor: A tool of harvest makes for a poor weapon, but a powerful casting focus.

cards.flavor: At home, the young man always had an audience waiting for him.
cards.name: Haunted Prodigy
cards.text:
Whenever Haunted Prodigy attacks, you may tap target creature.
Unveil {2}{W}{U} ({2}{W}{U}: Transform this. Unveil only as a sorcery.)

cards.flavor: Despite the loss of a man so young, none of his talent has been lost.
cards.name: Haunting Maestro
cards.text: Whenever Haunting Maestro attacks, you may tap or untap up to two target creatures.

cards.flavor: A pervasive pest feeding on the fires of the empire's industry.
cards.name: Hearth Dweller
cards.text:
Wither (This deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters.)
{X}{R}: Hearth Dweller gets +X/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Herald of Purity
cards.text:
Whenever Herald of Purity is dealt damage, it deals that much damage to any target.
Persist (When this creature dies, if it had no -1/-1 counters on it, return it to the battlefield under its owner's control with a -1/-1 counter on it.)

cards.flavor: A manifestation of divine right.
cards.name: Herald of Royalty
cards.text:
Lifelink
When Herald of Royalty enters, creatures you control get +1/+1 and gain vigilance until end of turn.

cards.flavor: History is rewritten by the victors.
cards.name: Historiamancer
cards.text: When Historiamancer enters, return target instant or sorcery card from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.flavor: Wormwood had gone to Madame Beatrice, asking after an apprentice who could pick more than mere pockets.
cards.name: Housebreak
cards.text:
Choose one —
• Exile target artifact.
• Target player exiles two artifacts they control with mana value 0.

cards.flavor:
“I knew a woman who raised a griffin better than any professional. A pity she never reared any after the first.”
—Lettie Wormwood
cards.name: Humble Tamer
cards.text: When Humble Tamer enters, create a 1/1 white Griffin creature token with flying.

cards.flavor:
“My rule is by divine right, and it shall elevate our citizens, willing or not.”
—Prince Regent Edgar
cards.name: Imperative Blessing
cards.text:
Enchant creature
When Imperative Blessing enters, draw a card.
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2.

cards.flavor: Each costly pursuit of life's essence yielded only failure, but those failures could be salvaged as casting materials.
cards.name: Imperfect Stone
cards.text:
When Imperfect Stone enters, mill three cards.
{T}: Add one mana of any color.

cards.flavor: Lettie, Barton, and Animus left before dawn. Then, the empire would awaken to a dead regent, and chaos's new reign.
cards.name: Imperial Capital
cards.text:
{T}: Add {C}.
{4}, {T}, Put a -1/-1 counter on a creature you control: Draw a card.

cards.flavor:
“Thousands will lay down their lives overseas before any sword can reach our shores.”
—Prince Regent Edgar
cards.name: Imperial Dragoon
cards.text:
First strike
When Imperial Dragoon enters, target creature gets +2/+0 until end of turn.

cards.flavor: Self hatred twisted into corporeal form.
cards.name: Infernal Echo
cards.text:
Enchant creature
At the beginning of combat on your turn, create a token that's a copy of enchanted creature, except it has haste. Exile that token at the beginning of the next end step.

cards.flavor: To be an angel is to be innocent and pure. It is to be willingly ignorant.
cards.name: Innocence Lost
cards.text: Mill three cards, then you may return a creature or land card from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.flavor: “What's more, the lord's nephew was seen fleeing into the night with some odd woman, why I never...”
cards.name: Insistent Ingenue
cards.text:
{1}{W}, {T}: Tap target creature.
Put a -1/-1 counter on Insistent Ingenue: Untap Insistent Ingenue.

cards.flavor: Mortals are eager to give a face to all the world's evils until they are staring past its teeth.
cards.name: Into the Maw of Hell
cards.text: Destroy target land. Into the Maw of Hell deals 13 damage to target creature.

cards.flavor: Free from artificial influence, the genius of the artist will create from nothing an authentic and beautiful work.
cards.name: Invigorating Chord
cards.text:
Untap all creatures you control.
Draw a card.

cards.name: Iron Backbite
cards.text:
Target creature you control deals damage equal to its power to another target creature.
Agonize (You may cast this card from your graveyard by putting a -1/-1 counter on a creature you control in addition to paying its other costs. Then exile this card.)

cards.name: Ironsnap Hunter
cards.text:
Flash
Persist (When this creature dies, if it had no -1/-1 counters on it, return it to the battlefield under its owner's control with a -1/-1 counter on it.)

cards.name: Lamplight Watchman
cards.text:
Vigilance
Persist (When this creature dies, if it had no -1/-1 counters on it, return it to the battlefield under its owner's control with a -1/-1 counter on it.)

cards.name: Leticia Petrine
cards.text:
{T}: Exile two target creature and/or land cards from a graveyard. Create a Vial token. (It's an artifact with “{1}, Sacrifice this and another permanent: Draw a card. Activate only during your turn.”)
{B}{G}, Sacrifice two Vials: Sacrifice Leticia Petrine, then return her to the battlefield transformed under her owner's control.

cards.name: Wormwood, the Estranged
cards.text:
[+2]: Put a -1/-1 counter on or remove a -1/-1 counter from up to one target creature.
[-1]: Draw a card, then each player sacrifices a nonland permanent.
[-10]: Destroy all nonland permanents you don't control.

cards.name: Life from Death
cards.text:
When Life from Death enters, create a Vial token. (It's an artifact with “{1}, Sacrifice this and another permanent: Draw a card. Activate only during your turn.”)
Whenever a nontoken creature you control dies, create a 1/1 green Saproling creature token.

cards.name: Lifespark Alchemist
cards.text:
When Lifespark Alchemist enters, create a Vial token. (It's an artifact with “{1}, Sacrifice this and another permanent: Draw a card. Activate only during your turn.”)
Whenever Lifespark Alchemist or another creature dies, each opponent loses 1 life.

cards.flavor: The little doctor learned to read before she could speak, and years later, Wormwood would still find respite in books.
cards.name: Literary Refuge
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +0/+2 and has “{T}: Draw a card.”

cards.flavor: They are not the sower, only the reaper of the rot that infects all life.
cards.name: Lord of Decay
cards.text:
Menace
When Lord of Decay enters, put a -1/-1 counter on it and each creature you don't control.

cards.name: Lost Moments
cards.text: Counter target spell, activated ability, or triggered ability. Its controller chooses draw step, main phase, or combat phase. That player skips each instance of the chosen step or phase during their next turn. (Mana abilities can't be targeted.)

cards.name: Lunar Pact
cards.text:
When Lunar Pact enters, target creature attacks during its controller's next combat if able.
Players can't untap more than two nonbasic permanents during their untap step.

cards.flavor: Faith in a conjecture meets the challenge of proving it.
cards.name: Maddening Theory
cards.text:
Draw a card.
Agonize (You may cast this card from your graveyard by putting a -1/-1 counter on a creature you control in addition to paying its other costs. Then exile this card.)

cards.flavor: When the Empire first conquered other shores, mer societies expanded deeper beneath the waves, out of human sight.
cards.name: Marine Delver
cards.text: Whenever Marine Delver attacks, draw a card.

cards.flavor: Royal artificers had created animated facsimiles, but nothing sustainable that could be defined as life.
cards.name: Mechanical Mastodon
cards.text: When Mechanical Mastodon enters, you may return another target permanent you control to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Militia Surgeon
cards.text:
When Militia Surgeon enters, you gain 2 life.
Persist (When this creature dies, if it had no -1/-1 counters on it, return it to the battlefield under its owner's control with a -1/-1 counter on it.)

cards.flavor: Both angels and spirits hold interest in mortal affairs. However, where angels command, spirits manipulate.
cards.name: Misleading Wisp
cards.text:
Sacrifice Misleading Wisp:
Counter target spell unless its controller pays {1}.

cards.flavor: Lettie's first concern was to find what had become of her old friend.
cards.name: Miss Margaret Barton
cards.text:
Noncreature spells your opponents cast cost {1} more to cast.
Unveil {2}{W}{U} ({2}{W}{U}: Transform this. Unveil only as a sorcery.)

cards.flavor: For once in her grim undertaking, Lettie felt joy, seeing the fine gentleman her old friend had become.
cards.name: Doctor Gareth Barton
cards.text:
Spells your opponents cast cost {1} more to cast.
Spells you cast cost {1} less to cast.

cards.flavor: The lab had tried to produce more like Animus, but also stored the reagents that Lettie would use to end that effort.
cards.name: Morningstar Blaze
cards.text: Morningstar Blaze deals X damage divided as you choose among one or two targets.

cards.name: Mortified Medium
cards.text:
Whenever Mortified Medium or another creature enters, you gain 1 life.
As long as you have at least 10 life more than your starting life total, Mortified Medium gets +4/+4 and has flying.

cards.flavor: “We are under the same heavens, and any sin is for all humanity to mourn.”
cards.name: Mourning Minister

rulings.text: This will cause planeswalkers to enter with 0 counters and make their + abilities unable to be used.

cards.text:
Players can't get counters.
Counters can't be put on permanents.

cards.name: Night Howlers
cards.text: When Night Howlers enters, target opponent reveals three cards from their hand and you choose one of them. Exile that card until Night Howlers leaves the battlefield.

cards.flavor:
“It warns away others to spare them its true nature. I chose to conceal mine.”
—Lettie Wormwood
cards.name: Night Shepherd
cards.text: When Night Shepherd enters, return a creature you control to its owner's hand.

cards.flavor: If one lives in the world's greatest society, what could dissent and misery be called but inhuman insanity?
cards.name: Nihilistic Treatment
cards.text: Choose X. Target player reveals their hand and discards all nonland cards with mana value X.

cards.flavor: None of the wards against fae she knew fazed it, so she thought it safe.
cards.name: Noonfiend
cards.text:
Wither (This deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters.)
{1}{B}: Return Noonfiend from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Opera House
cards.text:
Opera House enters tapped.
When Opera House enters, add one mana of any color.
{T}, Sacrifice Opera House: Search your library for a basic land card, put it onto the battlefield tapped, then shuffle.

cards.name: Osheen Courtier
cards.text:
All creatures able to block Osheen Courtier do so.
Persist (When this creature dies, if it had no -1/-1 counters on it, return it to the battlefield under its owner's control with a -1/-1 counter on it.)

cards.flavor: For all they destroy, demons are quite creative when interpreting pacts.
cards.name: Pact Equivocator
cards.text:
Lifelink
When Pact Equivocator enters, you lose 2 life and draw a card.

cards.flavor:
“Pyrophoric, toxic, and adhesive. My most cruel weapon on distant planes.”
—Lettie Wormwood
cards.name: Pale Morningstar Powder
cards.text: {2}, {T}, Sacrifice Pale Morningstar Powder: Put two -1/-1 counters on target creature.

cards.flavor: The lords assemble in the name of a common good: theirs.
cards.name: Parliamentary Lord
cards.text:
Creatures your opponents control enter tapped.
{7}{W}: Tap all creatures target player controls.

cards.flavor: What mortals have in common can be used for sympathetic destruction.
cards.name: Piercing Ritual
cards.text: Target creature you control deals damage equal to its power to any target. Then put a -1/-1 counter on that creature.

cards.flavor: Some fae play at the idea of mortal aristocracy, organizing into courts with which to serve vendettas.
cards.name: Pixie Lanceling
cards.text:
Flying
Wither (This deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters.)

cards.flavor: The apothecary's creed is that poison can cure, and any cure can poison.
cards.name: Plague Apothecary
cards.text:
Deathtouch
Unveil {3}{B}{G} ({3}{B}{G}: Transform this. Unveil only as a sorcery.)

cards.flavor: As poison can cure, so can death and rot bring life and twisted immortality.
cards.name: Plague Hostess
cards.text: Vigilance, deathtouch, menace

cards.flavor: When Haldean proposed to her, Leticia thought she had finally understood her life's purpose; her gift and curse.
cards.name: Prideful Gentleman
cards.text: As an additional cost to cast this spell, pay {2} or reveal an instant or sorcery card from your hand.

cards.flavor: Every peaceful alternative had been dismissed. The chosen seconds could only watch in horror as the duel began.
cards.name: Proper Duel
cards.text:
Target creature you control fights another target creature.
Each player draws a card.

cards.name: Publishing Press
cards.text:
As Publishing Press enters, you may exile a nonland card with mana value 2 or less from your hand.
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may cast a copy of the exiled card without paying its mana cost if the spell's mana value is 2 or less.

cards.flavor:
“Mixture of magic and chemistry has yielded far more vibrant warfare.”
—Professor Micheal Haldean
cards.name: Pyrophoric Blast
cards.text: Pyrophoric Blast deals 3 damage to target creature. If that creature would die this turn, exile it instead.

cards.name: Ravage of Moments
cards.text:
Enchant creature
When Ravage of Moments enters and at the beginning of your upkeep, put a -1/-1 counter on enchanted creature.

cards.flavor: Imported plants quickly adapted, and the fae just as quickly adopted them.
cards.name: Reaping Willow
cards.text:
You may have Reaping Willow assign its combat damage as though it weren't blocked.
{2}{G}: Reaping Willow gains indestructible until end of turn.

cards.name: Reckless Arson
cards.text:
Tap up to three target lands. They don't untap during their controller's next untap step.
Agonize (You may cast this card from your graveyard by putting a -1/-1 counter on a creature you control in addition to paying its other costs. Then exile this card.)

cards.name: Reckless Experiment
cards.text:
Exile the top three cards of your library. Until the end of your next turn, you may cast nonland cards exiled this way.
{3}{U}{R}: Return Reckless Experiment from your graveyard to the
battlefield tapped and transformed.

cards.name: Professor Haldean
cards.text:
If Professor Haldean would leave the battlefield, exile him instead.
Whenever you cast a spell, you may untap Professor Haldean and another target permanent.
{T}: Professor Haldean deals 1 damage to each opponent.

cards.flavor: Horrified as they are by the senseless suffering of mortals, some fae are pained more by the joy they witness.
cards.name: Reclusive Boggan
cards.text: Flash

cards.name: Renatured Vines
cards.text:
When Renatured Vines enters, draw a card and create a Vial token. (It's an artifact with “{1}, Sacrifice this and another permanent: Draw a card. Activate only during your turn.”)
Renatured Vines power and toughness are each equal to the number of cards in your hand.

cards.flavor: In a way, angels need demons. If not for the threat of the Abyss, would humanity sacrifice so much to obey?
cards.name: Repel the Darkness
cards.text:
Tap up to two target creatures.
Draw a card.

cards.flavor: A manifestation of a herd's scorn that turned their horns against the hunted.
cards.name: Returned Stag
cards.text: Persist (When this creature dies, if it had no -1/-1 counters on it, return it to the battlefield under its owner's control with a -1/-1 counter on it.)

cards.flavor:
“Doubly bound by wretched form and familial obligation, I resolved to free myself of both.”
—Doctor Barton
cards.name: Reviled Role
cards.text:
Enchant creature
As long as enchanted creature has toughness 3 or less, it can't attack or block.

cards.name: Riverchase Diver
cards.text:
{U}, {T}: You may tap or untap another target creature.
Whenever one or more other creatures you control deal combat damage to a player, you may untap Riverchase Diver.

cards.name: Romantic Recollections
cards.text:
Choose one —
• Return target instant or sorcery card from your graveyard to your hand.
• Return target exiled card with agonize you own to your hand.
Exile Romantic Recollections.

cards.flavor: Flight of fancy given form.
cards.name: Romantic Wisp
cards.text:
Flash
Flying
Romantic Wisp can block only creatures with flying.

cards.name: Rotten Grin
cards.text:
Enchant creature
{X}{B}: Enchanted creature gets +X/+X until end of turn.
When enchanted creature dies, return it to the battlefield under your control.

cards.flavor: Most fae are disgusted by alchemy, as they are by any human invention.
cards.name: Rotting Devotress
cards.text:
{T}, Pay 1 life: Add {C}.
Unveil {3}{B}{G} ({3}{B}{G}: Transform this. Unveil only as a sorcery.)

cards.flavor: Some study it nonetheless, hoping that a true-form can make them anything but what they are.
cards.name: Ingrained Virago
cards.text:
{T}: Add one mana of any color.
Whenever you tap Ingrained Virago for mana, each opponent loses 1 life.

cards.flavor: With alchemical arms and artillery, knights moved from front line steeds to command center tables.
cards.name: Royal Knight
cards.text:
First strike
Prevent all noncombat damage that would be dealt to Royal Knight.

cards.flavor: The hounds couldn't stay on track of any scent, but they did intimidate anyone who thought they could.
cards.name: Royster Hounds
cards.text: Royster Hounds can't be blocked by creatures with power 2 or less.

cards.flavor: Innocent blood is a powerful component for demonic pacts. With that, destructive magic can be granted with the confidence it will not be wasted.
cards.name: Sanguine Cut
cards.text: Target creature gets -3/-3 until end of turn. You gain 3 life.

cards.flavor: The true-form ritual consumed them from their heart outwards, only to halt short of their skin. Their ideal had never been more than fire in their veins.
cards.name: Scorching Blood
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/-2.

cards.name: Scorchmark Seer
cards.text:
Wither (This deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters.)
Whenever a creature with wither deals combat damage to an opponent, Scorchmark Seer deals 2 damage to that player.

cards.name: Sea's Allure
cards.text:
Ward {2} (Whenever this creature becomes the target of a spell or ability an opponent controls, counter it unless that player pays {2}.)
When Sea's Allure enters, gain control of target creature for as long Sea's Allure remains on the battlefield.

cards.flavor: “Neither my death nor yours will redeem you. That was only the wish of those who have always hated us.”
cards.name: Selfish Epiphany
cards.text:
Enchant creature
When Selfish Epiphany enters, search your library for a card and put that card into your hand. Then shuffle.
Enchanted creature has indestructible and can't be sacrificed.

cards.flavor: The sun never sets on the empire.
cards.name: Seraph of Sunset
cards.text:
Flying, vigilance, lifelink
Persist (When this creature dies, if it had no -1/-1 counters on it, return it to the battlefield under its owner's control with a -1/-1 counter on it.)

cards.flavor: Once created, a changeling cannot conceal their nature forever.
cards.name: Sharp Urchin
cards.text:
Flash
Unveil {3}{B}{G} ({3}{B}{G}: Transform this. Unveil only as a sorcery.)

cards.flavor: One easily rejects humanity when humanity has rejected them.
cards.name: Bramble Quickling
cards.text:
Wither (This deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters.)
When you unveil Bramble Quickling, you may have it fight target creature.

cards.name: Shattered Image
cards.text:
Create a token that's a copy of target creature.
Agonize (You may cast this card from your graveyard by putting a -1/-1 counter on a creature you control in addition to paying its other costs. Then exile this card.)

cards.flavor: Angelic law revels as much in proclamation as enforcement.
cards.name: Shining Censure
cards.text:
Choose one or more —
• Exile target artifact.
• Exile target enchantment.
• Exile target card from a graveyard.

cards.name: Shock or Disbelief
cards.text: Reveal the top four cards of your library and separate them into two piles. An opponent chooses one of those piles. Put that pile into your hand. Shuffle the other and up to four cards from your graveyard into your library.

cards.flavor: The romantic's heart is their master.
cards.name: Silent Call
cards.text:
Enchant creature
When Silent Call enters, draw a card.
Enchanted creature attacks each combat if able.

cards.name: Silver Gardener
cards.text:
When Silver Gardener enters, create a 1/1 green Saproling creature token.
Unveil {2}{G}{W} ({2}{G}{W}: Transform this. Unveil only as a sorcery.)

cards.name: Garden Cherub
cards.text:
Garden Cherub's power and toughness are each equal to the number of creatures you control.
Garden Cherub can't be blocked by creatures with power 2 or less.

cards.flavor: “The master thinks we're beneath him. It's a shame, then, that he never keeps an eye on us.”
cards.name: Skulking Servant
cards.text: {3}{W}: Tap target creature with power 4 or greater.

cards.flavor: Before Leticia and Haldean, the secret of true alchemical life had long eluded the empire's finest minds.
cards.name: Sleepless Scholar
cards.text:
Prowess
Whenever you cast a noncreature spell, you may mill two cards.

cards.flavor: With copies of her research in the royal palace, Lettie arranged with Beatrice a ruckus no guard could ignore.
cards.name: Sleeveless Errand
cards.text: You may change the targets of target instant spell, sorcery spell, or activated ability.

cards.flavor: Most believe Heaven's blessings and imperial enlightenment will protect them, until next the Abyss calls.
cards.name: Snarling Omen
cards.text:
Flash
Wither (This deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters.)

cards.name: Solar Pact
cards.text:
When Solar Pact enters, return up to two cards with different mana values from your graveyard to your hand.
Each player can't draw more than one card each turn.

cards.flavor: A growing alchemical life form is easy. A sustainable one, not so.
cards.name: Solvent Tide
cards.text: Whenever Solvent Tide attacks, create a Vial token. (It's an artifact with “{1}, Sacrifice this and another permanent: Draw a card. Activate only during your turn.”)

cards.flavor: Her duty is to understand all that was lost, and all that will be lost.
cards.name: Somber Seer
cards.text:
You may look at the top card of your library any time.
You may play lands from your graveyard and the top of your library.

cards.name: Soulraving Hunt
cards.text:
Soulraving Hunt's power and toughness are each equal to the number of lands you control.
Persist (When this creature dies, if it had no -1/-1 counters on it, return it to the battlefield under its owner's control with a -1/-1 counter on it.)

cards.name: Spectral Seize
cards.text:
Put target creature on top of its owner's library.
Agonize (You may cast this card from your graveyard by putting a -1/-1 counter on a creature you control in addition to paying its other costs. Then exile this card.)

cards.flavor: Blood can contaminate spells, and the act of spilling it has power of its own.
cards.name: Spell Throttle
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, put a -1/-1 counter on a creature you control.
Counter target spell.

changes: 2024-06-01 — Changed from 'first time' to perennial trigger.
cards.name: Spiritual Guidance
cards.text:
Once each turn, when you activate a nonmana ability, you may gain 1 life and draw a card.
{2}{W}{U}: You may tap or untap target creature or artifact.

cards.name: Starcrossed Widow
cards.text:
If a card would be put into an opponent's graveyard from anywhere, instead that card is revealed and put on the bottom of that player's library.
Unveil {3}{G}{W} ({3}{G}{W}: Transform this. Unveil only as a sorcery.)

cards.name: Starlight Guardian
cards.text:
When you unveil Starlight Guardian, you may put target card from your graveyard on top of your library.
If a card would be put into an opponent's graveyard from anywhere, exile that card instead.

cards.flavor: He served the family for generations, but his obligations outlived him.
cards.name: Stiff Butler
cards.text: When Stiff Butler enters, search target player's library for up to two cards and exile them. Then that player shuffles.

cards.flavor: Life so simply conjured only becomes another tool for trading death.
cards.name: Straw Officer
cards.text: Creatures blocking or blocked by Straw Officer have wither. (They deal damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters.)

cards.flavor:
“Beaten by the street's cruelty for years, to then become an enactor of such. I can scarcely blame them, only pity.”
—Madame Beatrice
cards.name: Street Husher
cards.text: Wither (This deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters.)

cards.flavor: In the deluge of discoveries, many wished to cast away the artifice of society—to return to a simpler time, surely before they had been taught evil.
cards.name: Sublime Truth
cards.text: Destroy target artifact or enchantment. You gain 2 life.

cards.flavor: Briefly, Leticia understood the injustice of the life she had endured. That spark tore her from death's clutches, and cast her into the multiverse as Wormwood.
cards.name: Sudden Solitude
cards.text: Choose up to one creature. Return the rest to their owners' hands.

cards.name: Sylvan Majesty
cards.text:
Enchant creature
When Sylvan Majesty enters, search your library for a Forest card, put it onto the battlefield tapped, then shuffle.
Enchanted creature gets +3/+3.

cards.flavor: “I see... two shades... one of lost past, one of lost future... each ensnared... by the other's fear... and pride.”
cards.name: Tasseography
cards.text: Draw three cards, then discard a card unless you exile two cards from your graveyard.

cards.name: Tattered Wisp
cards.text:
Flying
When Tattered Wisp enters, tap target creature an opponent controls. That creature doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step.

cards.flavor: What separates the mortal coil from beyond is, in truth, very little.
cards.name: Tear the Veil
cards.text:
Exile target permanent, then return that card to the battlefield under its owner's control.
Draw a card.

cards.flavor:
“This might hurt, but only for a second.”
—Doctor Gareth Barton
cards.name: Temporotomy
cards.text:
Take an extra turn after this one. During that turn, you may look at and play the top card of your library.
Exile Temporotomy.

cards.flavor:
“My old neighbors—who'd have thrown a lamb to the wolves if it kept them safe.”
—Lettie Wormwood
cards.name: Thatcher Militia
cards.text: Persist (When this creature dies, if it had no -1/-1 counters on it, return it to the battlefield under its owner's control with a -1/-1 counter on it.)

cards.name: The Mistake
cards.text:
As The Mistake enters, choose a card name.
Activated abilities of sources with the chosen name can't be activated unless they're mana abilities.
Unveil {5} ({5}: Transform this. Unveil only as a sorcery.)

cards.flavor: “I have read much of your philosophy. I found it lacked any conception of what I am—so what good is it?”
cards.name: Animus, Life's Mystery
cards.text: Activated abilities of sources you don't control can't be activated unless they're mana abilities.

cards.flavor: How fearful and dizzy it is, to cast one's eye so low, and see the dreadful trade across the strait.
cards.name: Thriving Bluff
cards.text:
Thriving Bluff enters tapped.
As Thriving Bluff enters, choose a color other than red.
{T}: Add {R} or one mana of the chosen color.

cards.flavor: Foreign cultivars were popular for those desiring the aesthetics of nature without the lurking fae.
cards.name: Thriving Grove
cards.text:
Thriving Grove enters tapped.
As Thriving Grove enters, choose a color other than green.
{T}: Add {G} or one mana of the chosen color.

cards.flavor: As industry drew the masses to cities, their old homes became favorite subjects of romanticism.
cards.name: Thriving Heath
cards.text:
Thriving Heath enters tapped.
As Thriving Heath enters, choose a color other than white.
{T}: Add {W} or one mana of the chosen color.

cards.flavor: Isles dot the channel separating the imperial homeland from its colonies and puppets.
cards.name: Thriving Isle
cards.text:
Thriving Isle enters tapped.
As Thriving Isle enters, choose a color other than blue.
{T}: Add {U} or one mana of the chosen color.

cards.flavor: None rival the might of the Empire, yet fae and demons freely terrorize its provinces.
cards.name: Thriving Moor
cards.text:
Thriving Moor enters tapped.
As Thriving Moor enters, choose a color other than black. 
{T}: Add {B} or one mana of the chosen color.

cards.flavor: Wormwood's spells were of great aid to Barton, yet also strangely familiar.
cards.name: Timely Cure
cards.text: Target permanent gains indestructible and hexproof until end of turn. Remove all -1/-1 counters from it.

cards.flavor: Once the earth has been bathed in blood and ash, the demons of the abyss will turn their wrath to the heavens.
cards.name: Towering Fiend
cards.text: Trample

cards.flavor: Before reagents, there was eye of newt.
cards.name: Traditional Ingredients
cards.text: You draw a card, lose 2 life, then create a Vial token. (It's an artifact with “{1}, Sacrifice this and another permanent: Draw a card. Activate only during your turn.”)

cards.flavor:
“We've seen enough opera to know what such bloodstained life leads to.”
—Lettie Wormwood
cards.name: Tragic End
cards.text: Destroy target creature with power less than or equal to the number of creature cards in your graveyard.

cards.flavor: The wealth of land is matched by inheritance law's rigidity—had the guild not required she marry, would Leticia have courted Haldean?
cards.name: Troubled Homesteader
cards.text: When Troubled Homesteader dies, draw a card.

cards.flavor: All Barton had left was faith in himself.
cards.name: True-Form Revelation
cards.text: Exile target creature. Its controller reveals cards from the top of their library until they reveal a creature card. The player puts that card onto the battlefield, then shuffles all other cards revealed this way into their library.

cards.flavor: “We know of no one to ever achieve a human true-form, even without solving erosion of memory and identity.”
cards.name: True-Form Scholar
cards.text: Activated abilities of creatures you control cost up to {1} less to activate. This effect can't reduce the mana in that cost to less than one mana.

cards.flavor: Spirits forge pacts with their lost kin, keen to free them from material bounds.
cards.name: Turn to Mist
cards.text: Exile target creature. Return that card to the battlefield under its owner's control at the beginning of the next end step.

changes: 2023-04-01 — Is now a sorcery and searches your graveyard in addition to your library.
2024-05-01 — Mana cost changed from XG. Can now find nongreen creatures.
cards.flavor: To their regret, Leticia and Haldean would succeed where so many had failed.
cards.name: Twisted Masterwork
cards.text: Search your library and/or graveyard for a creature card with mana value X or less and put it onto the battlefield with an additional -1/-1 counter on it. If you search your library this way, shuffle.

cards.flavor: “Here be dragons.”
cards.name: Uncharted Leviathan
cards.text:
Hexproof
When Uncharted Leviathan enters, target creature can't be blocked this turn.

cards.flavor: In his last moments, he yearned for the glory and warmth of enemy fire.
cards.name: Uncomfortable Chill
cards.text:
Creatures your opponents control get -2/-0 until end of turn.
Draw a card.

cards.flavor: Lettie thought to ask Barton if he was still the same person; not quite correct, as he had obviously changed. She finally asked, “Are you still my friend?”
cards.name: Undying Bond
cards.text: Return up to two target creature cards with total mana value 4 or less from your graveyard to the battlefield.

cards.flavor: Egos fit for the first chair will stoop to astonishing lows to secure it.
cards.name: Unstable Virtuoso
cards.text:
Menace
Unveil {3}{B}{R} ({3}{B}{R}: Transform this. Unveil only as a sorcery.)

cards.flavor: Perhaps by memory lost to age or transformation, he now considers his achievements entirely his own.
cards.name: Unvirtuous Maestro
cards.text: Unvirtuous Maestro can't be blocked except by three or more creatures.

cards.flavor: The unsustainability of necromancy was but one of many motivators for the search for true alchemical life.
cards.name: Unstill Unlife
cards.text: Return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield with an additional -1/-1 counter on it.

cards.flavor:
“I once wondered if I might be an urisk, doomed to spend my days offering everything for any friendly company.”
—Lettie Wormwood
cards.name: Urisk Fiddler
cards.text: When Urisk Fiddler enters, draw a card.

cards.flavor: Calm waves and a beguiling face both belie merciless depths.
cards.name: Veiled Merfolk
cards.text:
Veiled Merfolk can't be blocked by creatures with greater power.
When Veiled Merfolk enters, mill a card.

cards.name: Veilshaper
cards.text:
{T}: Add {C}. Spend this mana only to cast an instant or sorcery spell or activate an ability.
{2}{U}: Move a counter from target creature onto another target creature.

cards.flavor: Mortals are materials like any other.
cards.name: Vile Edict
cards.text:
Target player sacrifices a creature.
Create a Vial token. (It's an artifact with “{1}, Sacrifice this and another permanent: Draw a card. Activate only during your turn.”)

cards.name: Virtue of Resilience
cards.text:
{G}{W}, {T}: Remove a -1/-1 counter from target creature.
Persist (When this creature dies, if it had no -1/-1 counters on it, return it to the battlefield under its owner's control with a -1/-1 counter on it.)

cards.name: Virtuous Cadenza
cards.text:
Draw two cards, then discard two cards.
Agonize (You may cast this card from your graveyard by putting a -1/-1 counter on a creature you control in addition to paying its other costs. Then exile this card.)

cards.flavor: Rather than grow out of her interests, the once little doctor grew her own library.
cards.name: Voracious Interest
cards.text: Reveal cards from the top of your library until three creature and/or land cards are revealed this way. Put all creature and/or land cards revealed this way into your hand and the rest into your graveyard.

cards.name: Wall of Ivy
cards.text:
Defender
When Wall of Ivy enters, create a Vial token. (It's an artifact with “{1}, Sacrifice this and another permanent: Draw a card. Activate only during your turn.”)

cards.name: Wall of Rime
cards.text:
Defender
When Wall of Rime enters, tap target creature an opponent controls. That creature doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step.

cards.flavor: Every resident of Bedlam House had lost their mind—often after arriving.
cards.name: Wall of Seclusion
cards.text:
Defender
Whenever Wall of Seclusion blocks a creature, that creature doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step.

cards.flavor: There is little use in worrying.
cards.name: Warm One's Bones
cards.text:
Each instant and sorcery card in your graveyard gains agonize until end of turn.
Agonize (You may cast this card from your graveyard by putting a -1/-1 counter on a creature you control in addition to paying its other costs. Then exile this card.)

cards.flavor: Lettie Wormwood returned to her former home, to find that nothing had improved in her year of absence.
cards.name: Wasteland Watch
cards.text:
First strike
Wither (This deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters.)

cards.name: Wavering Sorcerer
cards.text:
Whenever Wavering Sorcerer attacks, you may switch its power and toughness until end of turn.
Unveil {3}{U}{R} ({3}{U}{R}: Transform this. Unveil only as a sorcery.)

cards.flavor: From waves of water to light, merfolk have their own expertise to contribute to imperial true-form magic.
cards.name: Shining Elementalist
cards.text: When you unveil Shining Elementalist, creatures can't block this turn.

cards.name: Wharf Lumper
cards.text:
Wharf Lumper can't be blocked by creatures with greater power.
Whenever Wharf Lumper attacks, mill a card. If that card was an instant or sorcery, Wharf Lumper gets +3/+0 until end of turn.

cards.flavor: To open it is to seal your own fate.
cards.name: Witch's Invitation
cards.text:
When Witch's Invitation enters, you may put a -1/-1 counter on target creature.
{2}, {T}: Tap target creature with a -1/-1 counter on it.

cards.flavor: Outcasts of mer society often turn to plundering imperial trade routes.
cards.name: Wretched Merfolk
cards.text:
Haste
When Wretched Merfolk enters, target creature can't block this turn.
